result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank A Lasecke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders the restitution determination be referred to the Court Commissioner.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court.  Victim Witness Coordinator Jane Iwanski in Court.  Witness Joseph Polarek in Court.

10:58a.m.  Court calls case and states appearances for the record.

11:00a.m.  Victim is sworn in.

Court questions Victim.
Victim makes statements to the Court.
Victim provides documents to the Court for review.
Victim continues with statements to the Court.

Atty Kryshak cross examines Victim.
Victim makes statements to the Court.

Victim makes final statements to the Court.

Atty Kryshak makes final statements to the Court.

Victim makes further statements to the Court.

BY THE COURT:
Court marks exhibits and will issue a written determination for final approval.

Victim questions the Court.
Court addresses Victim.
Victim reviews exhibits.

FTR:  11:20a.m.
Referral to Court Commissioner for Restitution Hearing

Defendant Frank A Lasecke in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Count 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Counts 1 and 3 thru 7 are dismissed and read-in. 

Victim is present in the Courtroom and makes a statement to the Court. 
Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Pay fine of $200 plus costs including the VWS and filing fee.  To be paid within 60 days. 
Court is ordering the restitution determination be referred to the Court Commissioner.

Judical Review Request 2-10-14 az

Defendant Frank A Lasecke not in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:55 PM Case is re-called.
Atty Cousins states that the file has not been found.
This case was not on Atty Cousin's calendar.

Defendant was to appear today at 1:30. Court looks up the complaint. This is Atty Knaapen's file.
Atty Cousins will take a moment to go and get the file.

3:57 PM Court is back in session.
Defendant has failed to appear.

Atty Cousins has no further information for the Court on this matter.
Summons was sent to Defendant January 10th, was not returned.

Court will take a moment to review the complaint, finds probable cause.

State requests a criminal warrant.

BY THE COURT:
Court will order a criminal warrant.
